title: How to write good research problem - Quora

response.answer_text: What you write reflects your comprehension about particular topics. Prior to writing research problems and formulate research questions, you have to comprehend the topics being studied and relevant past studies related to your current research. A good research problem has to convince the readers or scholars in your field why the problem is worthy of further investigation.

Depending on the institution, the research question forms the basis for research and what needs to be either qualitatively or quantitatively answered. However, typically, the research question is driven by the problem to be addressed, gap in the literature that pertains to the problem - justifying the need for further research, then the purpose. Without the research question(s) evolving in this manner, research may be like the proverbial “cart before the horse”. Follow a logical approach and research will have more chance of success.
